translation.ko: 제대로 이뤄지지 않는 경우를 조사하고 있었어요

translation.ko: 일부 서류에 보면 이렇게 쓰여 있어요

translation.en: or an eyewitness to the abuse.

And if there was no signed statement

[woman] I was cleaning my kitchen,

And they were both fussy,

I was wearing her while I cleaned the kitchen.

If it's ever going to come out, it's going to come out now."

I had heard there could be something wrong with Larry Nassar.
[woman] Hi, Mr. Alesia. My name is Jessica Howard.
translation.ko: 알레시아 씨, 안녕하세요 제시카 하워드라고 합니다

I think it would help...
bring justice to a lot of the people
translation.ko: 협회 정책 때문에 힘들어한 사람들을 위해

translation.en: who have been affected by USA Gymnastics and their policies.
translation.ko: 정의를 실현하는 일에 도움이 될 거라고 생각해요

translation.en: Thank you. Bye.
When the...
story came out in 2016...
Nassar just came back into my head.
When something hits you like...
that realization that it was sexual abuse...
and you haven't known, haven't thought about it...
it becomes...
so real.
Like it was yesterday.
Like it just happened to you. Like you are 15.
[Dantzscher] My head started kind of like spinning a little bit.
I've never told anybody, but...
I was like, "Wait a minute...
this doctor used to do very similar things to me."
At that point, I was...
still scared, but...
I was thinking, "If he is a pedophile...
and I...
don't do something about it, I can't live with that."
[man] I was approached by Jamie Dantzscher,
who was a 2000 Olympian.
And she told me
the story about this. Dr. Nassar,
and she felt like he had sexually assaulted her.
translation.ko: 자기가 성폭행을 당한 것 같다고 말하더군요

translation.en: I believed her.
After I agreed to take her case, I called The Indianapolis Star.
And I said, "Great article.
By the way, have you ever heard of a guy named Larry Nassar?"
I... I was stunned.
I mean, I just thought, "Now this is-- Now we're talking three people."
And these women didn't know each other.
How many more could there be?
[man 1] Oh, golly.
-[woman] Oh, dear. Oh, dear. Oh, dear. -[man 1] Oh, God.
-[woman] Oh, no. -Medical?
Shh-shh-shh. Easy. easy, easy, easy.
[man 2] You can obviously see the shaking of the head, the resignation.
Everybody knows this goes with the territory, and they hate it.
translation.ko: 선수라면 부상을 피하기 힘들단 건 알지만 그래도 보기 힘든 거죠

translation.en: [man 1] Medical staff. Dr. Larry Nassar on the floor.
He keeps these women together.
[Kwiatkowski] Larry Nassar had been the team doctor
for USA Gymnastics' women's program for 29 years.
translation.ko: 미국 여자 체조 팀의 의사를 맡았어요

translation.en: He was also a Michigan State University doctor at the time.
So he was this prominent member of the community...
when we got these allegations about him.
Hello and welcome to GymnasticsDoctor.com.
This is part of the sports medicine tender teaching moments.
translation.ko: 스포츠 의학에서 압통점을 다루는 법을 가르쳐드리죠

translation.en: I call these TTX.
Over and over and over.
Around and around and around.
It's amazing, the number of treatments
that these kids will get to keep them healthy enough
to sustain them at the World Championship level,
translation.ko: 올림픽 수준에서도 견딜 수 있도록 하기 위해서

translation.en: Olympic Championship level that they are.
Um, we'll treat them before practice.
We treat them after practice, then we treat them before the second practice.
translation.ko: 연습 후에도 하고 두 번째 연습 전에도 치료하죠

translation.en: There are two a day. We're there for the entire second practice.
translation.ko: 연습이 하루 2번으로 2번째 연습 때는 저희도 함께예요

translation.en: Then we treat them to the point that they go to bed.
translation.ko: 아이들이 자러 가는 순간까지 저희는 치료해요

translation.en: So we usually see them at seven in the morning
and get done at ten at night.
[man] In medical school, he worked as a trainer. He rose up as a volunteer.
translation.ko: 래리 내서는 의대에서 트레이너로 일하며 봉사를 했죠

translation.en: And then, when he got on the staff at Michigan State,
part of his requirement was to do community work.
translation.ko: 거기선 지역 봉사를 하는 게 필수였거든요

translation.en: He started a foundation for autistic children.
translation.ko: 그래서 자폐증 아이들을 위한 재단을 설립했어요

translation.en: And he seemed like this larger-than-life, um, better-than-real person.
Okay, let's see what else you guys have...
discovered down here.
We very quickly started putting together a story,
translation.ko: 이야기를 맞추는 데는 오랜 시간이 걸리지 않았죠

translation.en: and we split up those sources.
So Marisa flew out to California and, uh, met with John Manly and Jamie Dantzscher.
translation.ko: 머리사는 캘리포니아로 가서 존 맨리와 제이미 댄츠셔를 만났죠

translation.en: [Evans] Jessica Howard, at that time, had spoken to us,
translation.ko: 제시카 하워드는 당시 저희에게 이야기는 했으나

translation.en: but was not ready to be included in the story, even as a Jane Doe.
translation.ko: 익명으로라도 기사에 끼고 싶지 않아 했어요

translation.en: But her story helped us have confidence,
translation.ko: 하지만 제시카 이야기 덕에 확신이 섰습니다

translation.en: because it corroborated everything we'd heard from Jamie
and we'd heard from Rachael.
[Alesia] I happened to get Rachael's tip.
And she said it would be fine to do an interview on camera, on the record,
with her name...
in her home.
Tell me more about why now, why...
you know, why... why you're willing to be brave enough to talk with me.
translation.ko: 어쩌다 지금 이야기할 용기를 내신 건가요?

translation.en: Um, I didn't know a lot when I was 15,
but one thing I did know was that abuse victims aren't treated well.
translation.ko: 하지만 학대 피해자들이 좋은 취급을 못 받는 건 알았죠

translation.en: They are mocked. They are questioned. They are blamed. They are shamed.
translation.ko: 놀림당하고, 아무도 믿어주지 않고 비난과 수치를 당하고

translation.en: Um, and that does incredible damage to the healing process.
translation.ko: 그 탓에 상처를 치료하기가 쉽지 않아요

translation.en: I wish I could have dealt with it 16 years ago.
I don't think I could have, but I can now.
translation.ko: 그땐 못 했을 것 같아요 하지만 지금은 할 수 있어요

translation.en: I was very much a perfectionist,
and that's what attracted me to the sport of gymnastics,
was the perfection that it required.
But my family wasn't able to afford gym fees,
translation.ko: 근데 가족이 체육관비를 낼 형편이 못 돼서

translation.en: so I didn't start until I was almost 12.
Because, at that point, I could work,
and my siblings helped me clean the gym, and my mom worked to pay for my gym fees.
translation.ko: 형제들이 체육관 청소를 도왔고 엄마가 일해서 체육관비를 대셨죠

translation.en: But I was five-four when I started. Way too tall, long torso, wrong body type.
translation.ko: 하지만 키가 163cm라 너무 크고 상체도 길고 체형이 맞질 않았어요

translation.en: So I only competed at the club level and a low club level at that.
translation.ko: 그래서 동아리 정도 소모임 수준 경기에만 나갔죠

translation.en: So I only competed in Michigan.
I did it because I loved it. I was not any good.
[Dantzscher] I told my parents I wanted to do gymnastics when I was three years old.
'Cause I saw it on TV and...
I just saw these girls...

translation.en: That deserves an investigation.
Other questions?
USA Gymnastics once wrote to a gymnast
